problem.markdown: Q1. A cloth rarely used for making accurate measurements, because ( ) It is easily affected by moister and dampness ( ) Its length gets altered by stretching ( ) It is likely to twist and tangle ( ) It is not strong (x) All of the above Q2. A symbol shown in Fig. 15.12, indicates (x) Barbed wire ( ) Pipe line ( ) Rail line ( ) Stone fences ( ) Power line Q3. A symbol, shown in Fig. 15.13, indicates ( ) Power line (x) Telephone line ( ) Fenced road ( ) Barbed wire ( ) Pipe railing Q4. A symbol, shown in Fig. 15.14, indicates ( ) National highway ( ) Bridge on the road ( ) Tunnel ( ) Single railway line (x) Double railway line Q5. A symbol, shown in Fig. 15.15, indicates ( ) Chain line ( ) Tie line (x) Wire fencing ( ) Pipe railing ( ) Power line Q6. A symbol, shown in Fig. 15.16, indicates (x) Power line ( ) Pipe Railing ( ) Street lights ( ) Sewages line ( ) Underground cables Q7. Fig. 15.17 represents the symbol for ( ) Uneven land (x) Cultivated land ( ) marsh ( ) Rough pastures ( ) Hilly areas Q8. Fig. 15.18 indicates ( ) Bridge ( ) Culvert (x) Tunnel ( ) Canal lock ( ) Fenced road Q9. Fig. 15.19 represents (x) Canal lock ( ) Fairy ( ) Bridge ( ) Bridge with fencing ( ) Railway line Q10. Fig. 15.20 represents (x) Rough pastures ( ) Marsh ( ) Evergreen trees ( ) Cultivated land ( ) Decidous trees Q11. Fig. 15.21 is the indication of ( ) Historical place ( ) Water tank (x) Temple ( ) Residential house ( ) Fort Q12. In plane table survey the method used for locating details is ( ) Traversing ( ) Resection ( ) Radiation ( ) Intersection (x) (A) or (B) above Q13. The process of putting the plane table into some fixed position so that a line representing a certain direction on the plane is parallel to that direction in the field is known as (x) Orientation ( ) Resection ( ) Intersection ( ) Levelling ( ) Centring Q14. The first, second and third temporary adjustments to be made in plane table surveying are respectively (x) levelling, centering, orientation ( ) centering, levelling, orientation ( ) orientation, centering, levelling ( ) orientation, levelling, centering
problem.p: Q1. A cloth rarely used for making accurate measurements, because

choicegroup.choice: It is easily affected by moister and dampness
Its length gets altered by stretching
It is likely to twist and tangle
